utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Moving Shot towards The Waltham House. A phone is ringing.]

utterances.transcript: The Waltham Residence.
Oh...yes..is this..umm..Emily's Parents' house.

This is the housekeeper speaking. And by the way, young lady, that is not how one addresses a person on the telephone. First one identifies oneself and then asks for the person with whom one wishes to speak.
What are you saying?!
Now, let us try that again, shall we?

utterances.transcript_with_note: (The housekeeper hangs up.)

utterances.transcript: No! Ooh! Oh my god!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Shocked) No! Ooh! Oh my god! (Dials again.)

utterances.transcript: The Waltham Residence.
Hello. This is Phoebe Buffay. I was wondering, please, if-if it's not too much trouble, please, umm, might I speak to Miss Emily Waltham, please?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (In a British accent) Hello. This is Phoebe Buffay. I was wondering, please, if-if it's not too much trouble, please, umm, might I speak to Miss Emily Waltham, please?

utterances.transcript: Miss Waltham, is at the rehearsal dinner and it's not polite to make fun of people. Goodbye.
No no no, I'll be nice, I swear!!! Could you just give me the number for where they are?
I'm afraid, I'm not at liberty to divulge that information.

Ok, somebody is on their way to ruin wedding okay. And I have to warn somebody, alright. So if you don't give me that number then I'm going to come over there and kick your snooty ass all the way to New Glocken..shire.
Hangs up.
Hello, Hello. Ohh, OHH, she knew I could kick her ass.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: The Rehearsal Dinner Hall. Chandler, Joey, Ross, Emily, Monica, and all the bridal party are seated at the table. Chandler gets up to make a toast. <font color="#0000ff">He clinks his glass, but the napkin is still in the glass. Needless to say, it sounds weird. He takes out the napkin and clinks his glass again.]

utterances.transcript: I'd like to toast, Ross and Emily. Of course, my big toast will be tomorrow at the wedding, so this is kind of my little toast or Melba toast, if you will. Okay. I known Ross for a long time. In fact, I knew him when he was going out with his first girlfriend. And I thought things were going to work out for him.. Until the day he over inflated her. Ohh, Dear God..
utterances.transcript_with_note: I'd like to toast, Ross and Emily. Of course, my big toast will be tomorrow at the wedding, so this is kind of my little toast or Melba toast, if you will. (No one in the room laughs. He starts to get flustered.) Okay. I known Ross for a long time. In fact, I knew him when he was going out with his first girlfriend. (Ross looks embarrassed.) And I thought things were going to work out for him.. Until the day he over inflated her. (He laughs. Jack looks at Judy and no one in the room laughs.) Ohh, Dear God.. (A cellular phone rings.)

utterances.transcript: Hello, Waltham Interiors.
Oh, hi, Mrs. Waltham. I need to speak with ether one of the best men, or Ross's sister Monica.
Who is this?
Oh, I'm Phoebe Buffay. I'm one of Ross's best friends.
Where did you get this number?
I got it from your maid. She's a bitch, but I wore her down.
Well, if you're one of Ross's best friends, why aren't you here?
Yeah, um, I can't fly. I'm having my brother's babies.
Oh, am I on the radio?
No..umm, could I talk to one of them? It's very very important.
No, I'm bored with you now. I'm going to cut you off.
utterances.transcript_with_note: No, I'm bored with you now. I'm going to cut you off. (She hangs up.)

utterances.transcript: Ohh! Okay, I'm going to have to kick her ass too.

And I'm sure we're all very excited that Ross and Emily are getting married at Montgomery Hall. I mean to think, my friend getting married in Monty Hall. Ohh, come on!! Monty Hall!! Lets make a Deal!! Come on, you people!! All right, forget it!! Congratulations, Ross and Emily.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Frustrated he takes his headphones off.) Oh, oh oh!! I'm sorry, can I interrupt? You know I just want to say..That you are a horrible, horrible person.

utterances.transcript: Ehh, pardon me?
You say you love this man, yet you're about to ruin the happiest day of his life. I'm afraid I have to agree with you friend Pheebs.. This is a..this is a...terrible, terrible plan.
But he has to know how I feel!
But why? He loves this...this Emily person. No good can come of this.
Well I-I think your wrong.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Sighing) Well I-I think your wrong.

utterances.transcript: Oh-no.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh-no.(He bites his fist at her.)

utterances.transcript: Well, he doesn't really love her. I mean, it's just a rebound thing from me.... You'll see!
Fortunately, I won't. And by the way, it seems to be perfectly clear that you were on a break.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Fortunately, I won't. And by the way, it seems to be perfectly clear that you were on a break. (Rachel gasps and doesn't know what to say. He puts his headphones back on.)

utterances.transcript: Do something..... Something....

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Chandler comes out of the bathroom in a robe.)

utterances.transcript: Hey.
Hey.
Have you seen Monica?
I'm not seeing Monica.

utterances.transcript: What?

Oh my god!
I know! That's why we got to find Monica!! You know where she is?
No!! Okay!! What's with the third degree?! Why don't you just shine a light in my eyes?!

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: The church where Ross and Emily are to be married. Judy, Andrea, and Monica enter together.]

utterances.transcript: Oh my God! It's like a fairyland.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Looking around at the chapel.) Oh my God! It's like a fairyland.

utterances.transcript: I know, it's horrible isn't it?
Well, I love it. I only hope my wedding looks this good.
I just hope...
You can let some of them go by!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Angrily.) You can let some of them go by!(Judy and Andrea go to the front of the chapel. Joey approaches Monica.)

utterances.transcript: Pisst, Monica. Alright, we really need to start looking out for Rachel. I'll cover the front door. You watch that big hole at the back of the building and I got Chandler covering Ross.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Whispering.) Pisst, Monica. Alright, we really need to start looking out for Rachel. I'll cover the front door. You watch that big hole at the back of the building and I got Chandler covering Ross.

utterances.transcript: Why would I care where Chandler is? You know uhh...You know sometimes I don't even like Chandler.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Awkwardly.) Why would I care where Chandler is? You know uhh...You know sometimes I don't even like Chandler.

utterances.transcript: Okay.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Okay. (They both walk off to watch for Rachel.)
(Ross and Chandler are standing next to the alter. Ross is practising for the wedding.)

utterances.transcript: I do. I do. I do.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Using a slightly different inflection for each.) I do. I do. I do.

utterances.transcript: Oh yea, your right. It's the second one.
Really?

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Joey's in the front entrance watching for Rachel. The bridesmaid he met at the rehearsal dinner come in.)

utterances.transcript: Hello Joey.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (In a sexy voice.)Hello Joey.

utterances.transcript: Hey, Felicity.
Umm, I thought about you all day.
Yeah.
Um-hum. Talk New York to me again.
Fuggetaboutit. How you doin?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (In a New York accent.) Fuggetaboutit. (She giggles.) How you doin?

utterances.transcript: Mmm.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Mmm. (She pushes him up against the wall and they begin to kiss.)

utterances.transcript: Oh, yeah.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Back in the chapel. The parents are still fighting over the bill. Ross is refereeing.)

utterances.transcript: There's nothing to discuss. We're not paying for your wine cellar.
You-you have to meet me in the middle here.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Pleading.) You-you have to meet me in the middle here.

utterances.transcript: Hey, you keep pushing me on this, my foots going to meet the middle of your ass.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Forcefully.) Hey, you keep pushing me on this, my foots going to meet the middle of your ass.

utterances.transcript: Dad!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Dad!! (Emily comes running in.)

utterances.transcript: What-what's going on?!
Nothing, nothing. Everything's under control.
You want a piece of me, sir? Is that what your saying? You want a piece of me?
utterances.transcript_with_note: You want a piece of me, sir? Is that what your saying? (Pointing at Jack and poking him) You want a piece of me?

utterances.transcript: Okay! Okay! That's it!! Parents!! Parents!! Back away!! All right, this is our wedding day! From now on everyone gets along, and if I hear one more word. NO GRANDCHILDREN! That's right!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Stepping in between them.)Okay! Okay! That's it!! Parents!! Parents!! Back away!! All right, this is our wedding day! From now on everyone gets along, and if I hear one more word. NO GRANDCHILDREN! (Pointing at his mother.) That's right!!

utterances.transcript: Okay, okay.
Sorry old boy, sorry. Sorry. Sorry. I could kill you with my thumb, you know.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Sorry old boy, sorry. Sorry. Sorry. (Them all walk away. As he leaves he mutters to Jack.) I could kill you with my thumb, you know.

utterances.transcript: What was all that about?
It was...This disagreement over... My god. You...you look beautiful.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Sighing.) It was...This disagreement over...(She sighs. Ross notices her in her wedding dress.) My god. You...you look beautiful.

utterances.transcript: Ohh... Oh! You were not meant to see me before the wedding. It's bad luck.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Giggles.) Ohh...(She realises that she's in her gown.) Oh! You were not meant to see me before the wedding. It's bad luck.

utterances.transcript: You know what, I think we've had all the bad luck we're going to have.
utterances.transcript_with_note: You know what, I think we've had all the bad luck we're going to have. (He hugs her.)

(The front entrance. Joey and the bridesmaid are up against the wall kissing. Rachel comes in the door and walks by Joey unnoticed. She walks into the chapel and sees Ross and Emily kissing. She looks as though she wants to cry. Emily walks away and Ross turns and sees Rachel standing there.)

utterances.transcript: My God. Rachel! Your here. I can't believe it. What happen? Why are you here?
utterances.transcript_with_note: My God. Rachel! (He walks towards her, grasps her hands and kisses her on the cheek.) Your here. I can't believe it. (She giggles.) What happen? Why are you here?

utterances.transcript: Well I just came... I just needed to tell you... Congratulations.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Well I just came...(She touches him near his heart. She's almost in tears.) I just needed to tell you...(Looking into his eyes. She takes a deep breath.) Congratulations. (He hugs her. She can barely hold back the tears.)

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Camera fades to one of the band members playing guitar at the wedding. The chapel is full of guest. A groomsmen escorts a bridesmaid down the isle. Joey is waiting with Mrs. Waltham to escort he down the isle. A cellular phone rings.]

utterances.transcript: Hello, Waltham Interiors.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Answering the phone.) Hello, Waltham Interiors.

utterances.transcript: Mrs. Waltham. Hi. It's Phoebe again.
Why?!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Throws her head back in disgust.) Why?!

utterances.transcript: Yea. Can I please, please, please talk to one of the best men? This is going to be the last time I promise.
Joey there's a girl on the phone for you.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Slapping the phone into Joey's chest.) Joey there's a girl on the phone for you.

utterances.transcript: Ohh great!! Hello.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Smiling.) Ohh great!! (Putting the phone to his ear.) Hello. (He begins to escort her down the aisle.)

utterances.transcript: Joey, it's Phoebe. Did you stop Rachel?
No, but it's okay. She just came in and gave him a hug, that it.
So nothing got ruined?
No.
Oh that's so great! Ohh, so what's going on now?

Ah, I'm-I'm walking down the aisle...Still walking. I'm about to pass the bridesmaid I hooked up with last night. Hey! I told her "Hey." And now I'm at the front with Ross. It's Phoebe. He looks pretty mad. Uh...I'd better go.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Ah, I'm-I'm walking down the aisle...Still walking. (Mrs. Waltham takes her place.) I'm about to pass the bridesmaid I hooked up with last night. (Looking at the bridesmaid.) Hey! (Talking to Phoebe.) I told her "Hey." And now I'm at the front with Ross. It's Phoebe. (He shows Ross the phone.) He looks pretty mad. Uh...I'd better go.

utterances.transcript: No!! wait, wait, wait!! Oh please, hold it up so I can listen.
utterances.transcript_with_note: No!! wait, wait, wait!! Oh please, hold it up so I can listen. (Joey looks at Ross and holds the phone above Ross's shoulder.)
(Chandler escorts Monica down the aisle.)

utterances.transcript: What we did last night was....
Stupid.
Totally crazy stupid.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Totally crazy stupid. (He nods his head at the people seated.)

utterances.transcript: What were we thinking?
I'm coming over tonight though, right?
Oh yeah. Definitely.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (They quickly take their places and Here Comes the Bride begins to play. Everyone seated looks back. Emily is being escorted up the aisle by her father. She kisses him on the cheek and takes her place by Ross's side.)

utterances.transcript: Friends. Family. We are gathered to celebrate here today the joyous union of Ross and Emily. May the happiness we share with them today be with them always. Now Emily, repeat after me. I, Emily...
I, Emily...
Take thee Ross...
Take thee Ross...
As my lawfully wedded husband, in sickness and in health, till death parts us.
As my lawfully wedded husband, in sickness and in health, until death parts us.
Now Ross, repeat after me. I Ross...
I Ross...
Take thee, Emily...
Take thee, Rachel... Emily. Emily.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Take thee, Rachel...(All his friends have looks of shock on their faces. He realises what he said. Quickly he says.) Emily. (A slight chuckle.) Emily.
(Rachel looks all around as if all the eyes in the chapel were looking at her.)

utterances.transcript: He-he said Rachel, right? Do you think I should go up there?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (To the woman sitting in front of her) He-he said Rachel, right? Do you think I should go up there?

utterances.transcript: Uhh...Shall I go on?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Looking and feeling awkward. he looks towards Emily.) Uhh...Shall I go on?
{Transcriber's Note This is orginally where the season four cliffhanger was. So you all have to wait four months before reading on.}

utterances.transcript: Yes, yes, do go on.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Cut to the parents.)

utterances.transcript: He better go on for what I'm paying.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Mr. Waltham) He better go on for what I'm paying.

utterances.transcript: After what he just said, you're paying for the whole bloody lot.
I think we'd better start again. Ross, repeat after me. I, Ross...
I, Ross...
Take thee, EM-I-LY...
Take thee, Emily. Like there'd be anybody else.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Take thee, (Glares at the Minister) Emily. (Chuckles) Like there'd be anybody else. (Emily is glaring at him.)

utterances.transcript: As my lawfully wedded wife, in sickness and in health, till death parts us.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Cut to the Walthams.)

utterances.transcript: Looks like that might come any minute.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Mr. Waltham) Looks like that might come any minute.

utterances.transcript: As my lawfully wedded wife, in sickness and in health, until death parts us. Really, I do. Emily.
utterances.transcript_with_note: As my lawfully wedded wife, in sickness and in health, until death parts us. Really, I do. Emily. (Points at her.)

utterances.transcript: May I have the rings? Emily, place this ring on Ross's finger as a symbol of your bond everlasting. Ross, place this ring in Emily's hand as a symbol of the love that encircles you forever.
utterances.transcript_with_note: May I have the rings? (He is given the rings) Emily, place this ring on Ross's finger as a symbol of your bond everlasting. (She jams the ring onto his finger) Ross, place this ring in Emily's hand as a symbol of the love that encircles you forever.

utterances.transcript: Happy to.
Ross and Emily have made their declarations and it gives me great pleasure to declare them husband and wife.
Yay!
You may kiss the bride.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (He goes to kiss her, but she isn't very receptive of the kiss. She keeps avoiding him, until Ross finally gets to kiss her on her cheek.)

utterances.transcript: This is worse than when he married the lesbian.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (To Mr. Geller) This is worse than when he married the lesbian.
(The band starts to play, and the recessional starts. Ross tries to take Emily's hand, but she snatches it away from him.)

utterances.transcript: Just keep smiling.
Okay.
Well, that went well. Yeah.
It could've been worse, he could've shot her.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Ross and Emily make it to the lobby.)

utterances.transcript: That uh, that was pretty funny. Wasn't it?

(Emily gives him a forearm shot across the stomach.)

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: The Wedding reception, Ross and Emily are in the bathroom and Emily is yelling at him. Rachel, Chandler, Joey, and Monica are standing outside the doorway.]

utterances.transcript: You've spoiled everything! It's like a nightmare! My friends and family are out there! How can I face them?! How can you do this to me?!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Yelling from inside the bathroom) You've spoiled everything! It's like a nightmare! My friends and family are out there! How can I face them?! How can you do this to me?!

utterances.transcript: Hey, no matter what happens with Ross and Emily, we still get cake right?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (To the gang) Hey, no matter what happens with Ross and Emily, we still get cake right?

utterances.transcript: That-that-that's all right, no honey, you take your time sweetie. I'll be right out here. She's just fixing her makeup.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (exiting the bathroom) That-that-that's all right, no honey, you take your time sweetie. I'll be right out here. (She slams the door in his face, to the gang) She's just fixing her makeup.

utterances.transcript: I hate you!!
And, I love you!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: And, I love you!! (He walks into the living room)

utterances.transcript: Boy, bad time to say the wrong name, huh Ross?
That's true, thanks dad. People should be dancing! Huh? Hey, this is a party! Come on! Joey, dance!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: That's true, thanks dad. (To All) People should be dancing! Huh? Hey, this is a party! Come on! Joey, dance!! (He starts to dance but stops when no one else joins him.)
(Mrs. Waltham's phone rings and she answers it.)

utterances.transcript: Yes, Waltham interiors.
Uh, hello, this is Ross Geller's personal physician, Dr. Philange.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (On the phone, in New York) Uh, hello, this is Ross Geller's personal physician, Dr. Philange.

utterances.transcript: Who?
Yeah, I've discovered that Ross forgot to take his brain medicine, uh, now without it, uh, in the brain of Ross, uh women's names are interchangeable, through-through no fault of his own.
Oh my God, Phoebe.
No, not Phoebe, Dr. Philange. Oh no! You have it too!

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Mrs. Waltham hangs up on her.)

utterances.transcript: Hello? What kind of bitch hangs up on a doctor!

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Cut to Chandler and Monica at the buffet table.)

utterances.transcript: Hey.
Hey.
Oh wow, I hope you don't take this the wrong way but, I know we had plans to meet up tonight and, ugh, I'm just kinda worried about what it might do to our friendship.
I know. How could we have let this happen?
Seven times!
Ugh! Well, y'know, we were away...
In a foreign, romantic country...
I blame London.
Bad London!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Bad London! (Takes a spoon and smacks the turkey.)

utterances.transcript: So look umm, while we're st-still in London, I mean, we can keep doing it right?
Well, I don't see that we have a choice. But, when we're back home, we don't do it.
Only here.
Y'know, I saw a wine cellar downstairs...
I'll meet you there in two minutes.
Okay!

utterances.transcript_with_note: (He throws down his plate and runs to the wine cellar, Monica is about to follow him but is intercepted by Rachel.)

utterances.transcript: Mon, honey, I gotta ask you something.
Now?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (impatiently) Now?

utterances.transcript: Ross said my name up there, I mean, come on, I just can't pretend that didn't happen can I?
Oh, I-I don't know.
Monica, what should I do?
Just uh, do the right thing.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Just uh, do the right thing. (Uses some breath spray)

utterances.transcript: What?
Toe the line. Thread the needle. Think outside the box!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Toe the line. Thread the needle. Think outside the box! (Tries to leave, but is stopped by Rachel.)

utterances.transcript: Whoa, wait, listen, I think I'm just gonna talk to Ross about what he think it meant.
Wait. Rachel, no, he's married. Married! If you don't realise that, I can't help you.
Okay, you're right. You're right. You can't help me.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Cut to Mr. and Mrs. Geller.)

utterances.transcript: Jack, is it all our fault? Were we bad parents?
Yes.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (walking by) Yes.

utterances.transcript: Oh yeah, well who serves steak when there's no place to sit, I mean how are you supposed to eat this?
Hey, what's up?
utterances.transcript_with_note: Hey, what's up? (He has solved the problem of eating the steak, he's eating it with his hands.)

utterances.transcript: You and me, next dance?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (motions to himself and Mrs. Geller and grins) You and me, next dance?
(Cut to Rachel who is walking past Mrs. Waltham.)

utterances.transcript: Sweetheart, sweetheart...
Yes?
You know, we're all wondering who this Rachel is. Can you point her out to me?
Oh, you know what? Rachel.. She just left.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh, you know what? Rachel.. She just left. (Points at the entrance.)

utterances.transcript: Oh.. Never mind. Who are you?
Ra.... Er.. Barbra.
Red Barbra?
Yeah.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah. (Smiles uneasily.)
(Cut to Monica and Chandler, Monica is running up to him.)

utterances.transcript: Where were you? We were supposed to meet in the wine cellar?
Forget it, that's off.
Why?!
The next tour of the wine cellar will plan in two in-in minutes...
utterances.transcript_with_note: (drunkenly) The next tour of the wine cellar will plan in two in-in minutes...
(Joey walks up to them.)

utterances.transcript: Joey, what are you doing? You promised Phoebe you wouldn't eat meat until she has the babies!
Well, I figured we're in another country, so it doesn't count.
That's true.
The man's got a point.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Cut to Rachel and Ross.)

utterances.transcript: Oh, hi!
Hi!
Hi. Sorry, things aren't working out so well.
Oh no! It could be better, but it's gonna be okay, right?

Oh yeah! Of course, I mean, she's gonna get over this, y'know? I mean, so you said my name! Y'know you just said it 'cause you saw me there, if you'd have seen a circus freak, you would've said, "I take thee circus freak." Y'know, it didn't mean anything, it's just a mistake. It didn't mean anything. Right?
No! No! Of course it didn't mean anything! I mean, uh well, I can understand why Emily would think it meant something, y'know, because-because it was you...
Right...
But it absolutely didn't. It didn't!! It didn't!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: But it absolutely didn't. (Yelling towards the bathroom) It didn't!! It didn't!!

utterances.transcript: Ross, hey, the band's ready outside for your first dance with Emily, so...
utterances.transcript_with_note: (approaching) Ross, hey, the band's ready outside for your first dance with Emily, so...

utterances.transcript: Oh! Oh-oh, the band's ready! Well, I-I-we gotta do what the band says-I don't care about the stupid band!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (sarcastic) Oh! Oh-oh, the band's ready! Well, I-I-we gotta do what the band says-I don't care about the stupid band!!

utterances.transcript: You spit on me man!
utterances.transcript_with_note: You spit on me man! (Wipes his face.)

utterances.transcript: Look, I'm sorry.
Emily is kinda taking a long time, huh?
Y'know when I locked myself in the bathroom at my wedding, it was because I was trying to pop the window out of the frame.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (laughs) Y'know when I locked myself in the bathroom at my wedding, it was because I was trying to pop the window out of the frame.

utterances.transcript: Oh, right!
Get the hell out of there, y'know?

utterances.transcript_with_note: (They all start laughing, and quickly stop when they realise what she just said and run over to the bathroom.)

utterances.transcript: Emily? Emily? I'm coming in.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Bangs on the bathroom door) Emily? Emily? I'm coming in. (He opens the door to reveal that the window is gone, along with Emily.)

utterances.transcript: Well, look at that, same thing.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: London Marriott, Monica and Chandler are walking to her room.]

utterances.transcript: Listen, in the middle of everything if I scream the word, "Yippee!" just ignore me.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (She laughs and opens the door to reveal Rachel sitting on the bed.)

utterances.transcript: Oh my God, Rachel! Hi!
Oh, hello Rachel.
Ross said my name. Okay? My name.
How did you get in here?
If anybody asks, I'm your sister, Joan. Listen. C'mon, you guys. Ross said my name up there that obviously means that he still loves me!
Your sister Joan is crazy.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Monica) Your sister Joan is crazy.

utterances.transcript: Y'know what? Fine, I don't care. Don't believe me, I know I'm right-do you guys want to go downstairs and get a drink?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (They both just stare at her.)Y'know what? Fine, I don't care. Don't believe me, I know I'm right-do you guys want to go downstairs and get a drink?

utterances.transcript: Yes, we do. But, we have to change first.
Yes, I want to change. And why-why don't you go down and get us a table?
Yeah, we'll be down in like five minutes.
Fifteen minutes.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (elbows him) Fifteen minutes.

utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (The phone rings and Rachel answers it.)

utterances.transcript: Hello? Oh, Pheebs! It's Phoebe!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Hello? Oh, Pheebs! (To them) It's Phoebe!

utterances.transcript: Oh, yay...
Great...
Hi!
Hi, so what happened?
Well, Ross said my name.
Yeah, I know, but I don't think that means anything.

Okay, Pheebs, y'know what, let's look at this objectively all right? Ninth grade, right? The obsession starts. All right? The summer after ninth grade he sees me in a two-piece for the first time, his obsession begins to grow. So then...
Hey, listen, why don't we go change in my room?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (To Monica) Hey, listen, why don't we go change in my room?

utterances.transcript: But my clothes are-ohh!
utterances.transcript_with_note: But my clothes are-ohh! (They both leave.)
(Cut to Chandler's room, he opens the door slowly to see if Joey is there and after seeing that he isn't, ushers Monica into the room, closes the door, and the security bar.)

utterances.transcript: Wow, you look...
No time for that!

utterances.transcript_with_note: (They both start to frantically rip each other's clothes off, but are interrupted when Joey tries to open the door.)

utterances.transcript: Hey, dude, let me in. I got a girl out here!
Well, I've got a girl in here.
No you don't, I just saw you go in there with Monica!
Well, we're-we're hanging out in here!
Look, which one of us is gonna be having sex in there, me or you?
Well, I suppose I'd have to say you!! But, what if we're watching a movie in here?
Which we are, and-and we already paid for it. It's My Giant!
My Giant? I love that movie!

utterances.transcript: You really think this is okay?
Well, Ross and Emily aren't gonna use it.

Oh Mon-Mon-Mon-Mon-look, this is the honeymoon suite. The room expects sex. The room would be disappointed if it didn't get sex. All of the other honeymoon suites would think it was a loser.
Okay!
Okay!

utterances.transcript_with_note: (They both run to rip the covers off the bed, but are interrupted by Ross.)

utterances.transcript: Emily?!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (entering) Emily?!

utterances.transcript: Nope, not under here!
You didn't find her?
No, I've looked everywhere!
Well, you couldn't have looked everywhere or else you would've found her!
Yeah, I think you should keep looking!
Yeah, for about 30 minutes.
Or 45.
Wow, in 45 minutes you can find her twice.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Wow, in 45 minutes you can find her twice. (Monica smiles at that.)

utterances.transcript: No! For all I know, she's trying to find me but couldn't because I kept moving around. No, from now on, I'm staying in one place. Right here.
utterances.transcript_with_note: No! For all I know, she's trying to find me but couldn't because I kept moving around. No, from now on, I'm staying in one place. (He sits down on the bed.) Right here.

utterances.transcript: Well, it's getting late.
Yeah, we're gonna go.
Actually, do you guys mind staying here for a while?
Ugh, y'know, umm we gotta get up early and catch that plane for New York.
Yeah, it's a very large plane.
That's cool.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (disappointed) That's cool.

utterances.transcript: But, we'll stay here with you.
Thanks guys! I really appreciate this, y'know, but you don't have to rub my butt.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Thanks guys! (They both sit down on either side of him.) I really appreciate this, y'know, but you don't have to rub my butt.
(Chandler slowly takes his hand away.)

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Ross and Emily's room, the next morning. Ross is now asleep and has his head in Monica's lap and his feet on Chandler's lap. Monica and Chandler are both still awake and depressed.]

utterances.transcript: We have to leave for New York in an hour.
I know, I've been looking at those doors, they look pretty sound proof, don't you think?
We can't do that that's insane. I mean 'A' he could wake up and 'B' y'know, let's go for it.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (They both try to slowly extricate themselves from Ross, but there's a knock on the door that awakens him.)

utterances.transcript: Em-Emily? Em-Emily? Emily!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Em-Emily? (Looking around for her.) Em-Emily? (He runs to the door.) Emily! (He opens the door to reveal the Walthams standing outside.)

utterances.transcript: No.
You can forget about Emily, she's not with us.
We've come for her things.
Wait, well wh-wh-wh-where is she?
She's in hiding. She's utterly humiliated. She doesn't want to see you ever again.
We're very sad that it didn't work out between you and Emily, monkey. But, I think you're absolutely delicious.
Excuse me, I'm standing right here!
Oh yes, there you are.
Hey-hey, you guys oh hurry up, get some, there's a whole cart outside...
utterances.transcript_with_note: (entering, carrying an armful of those little soaps.) Hey-hey, you guys oh hurry up, get some, there's a whole cart outside... (Sees the Walthams and stops.)

utterances.transcript: Goodbye Geller.

Now, hold on! Hold on! Look, look, your daughter and I are supposed to leave tonight for our honeymoon, now-now you-you tell her that I'm gonna be at that airport and I hope that she'll be there too! Oh yeah, I said Rachel's name, but it didn't mean anything, Okay? She's-she's just a friend and that's all! That's all! Now just tell Emily that I love her and that I can't imagine spending my life with anyone else. Please, promise me that you'll tell her that.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Now, hold on! Hold on! (Stops him) Look, look, your daughter and I are supposed to leave tonight for our honeymoon, now-now you-you tell her that I'm gonna be at that airport and I hope that she'll be there too! Oh yeah, I said Rachel's name, but it didn't mean anything, Okay? She's-she's just a friend and that's all! (Rachel sits down, depressed.) That's all! Now just tell Emily that I love her and that I can't imagine spending my life with anyone else. Please, promise me that you'll tell her that.

utterances.transcript: All right, I'll tell her. Come on bugger face!
utterances.transcript_with_note: All right, I'll tell her. (To his wife) Come on bugger face!

utterances.transcript: Call me.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: A 747 somewhere over the North Atlantic, Monica and Chandler are sitting in first class, depressed.]

utterances.transcript: Y'know, maybe it's best that we never got to do it again.
Yeah, it kinda makes that-that one night special. Y'know, technically we still are over international waters.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah, it kinda makes that-that one night special. (Realises something) Y'know, technically we still are over international waters.

utterances.transcript: I'm gonna go to the bathroom, maybe I'll see you there in a bit?
'Kay!

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Monica gets up and heads for the bathroom, Chandler turns to watch her go and is startled to see Joey sitting in Monica's seat.)

utterances.transcript: Can I ask you something?
Uhh, no.
Felicity and I, we're watching My Giant, and I was thinking, "I'm never gonna be as good an actor as that giant." Do you think I'm just wasting my life with this acting thing?
No.
I mean, the giant is like five years younger than me, y'know, you think I'll ever get there?
Yes.
Thanks man.
Okay man.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Okay man. (Chandler starts to get up.)

utterances.transcript: But what about how much taller he is than me?

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Time lapse, Chandler is finishing his third little bottle of booze.)

utterances.transcript: I mean, there's no way I can make myself taller now, y'know? And who knows what science will come up with in the future, but Chandler, what if I die an unsuccessful, regular sized man?

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Monica returns.)

utterances.transcript: Hey, Monica, wow you've been in the bathroom for like a half-hour.
I know!
Had the beef-tips, huh?

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: An airport in London, Ross is waiting for Emily to show up to go on their honeymoon and sees Rachel walking past.]

utterances.transcript: Rach! Rach!
Hi!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (she stops and turns) Hi!

utterances.transcript: Hi! What are you, what are you doing here?
Well, I-I-I've been on Standby for a flight home for hours.
Oh.
Ohh, so no sign of Emily huh?
Not yet.
So umm, what time are you supposed to leave?
This is the last call for Flight 1066 to Athens. The last call.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (On the P.A.) This is the last call for Flight 1066 to Athens. The last call.

utterances.transcript: Pretty soon I guess.
Yeah. I'm sorry.
I just, I don't understand, I mean, how-how can she do this? Y'know, what, am I, am I like a complete idiot for thinking that she'd actually show up?
No, you're not an idiot, Ross. You're a guy very much in love.
Same difference.
All ticketed passengers for Flight 1066 to Athens should now be on board.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (On the P.A.) All ticketed passengers for Flight 1066 to Athens should now be on board.

utterances.transcript: I get it! Well, that's that.
No, you know what, I think you should go.
What?
Yeah, I do. I think you should go, by yourself, get some distance, clear your head, I think it'd be really good.
Oh, I don't, I don't, I don't know...
Oh, come on Ross! I think it would be really good for you!
I could, yeah, I can do that.
Yeah.
I can't, I can't even believe her! No, y'know what, I am, I am gonna go!
Good!
I know, why not?
Right!
Right?
Right!
Y'know-thanks!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Y'know-thanks! (They hug)

utterances.transcript: Okay, I'll see you back at home, if I ever get a flight out of here.
Yeah, well...nah.
What? Wait, what?
Why don't you come, I mean, I-I have two tickets, why not?
Well-well, I don't know Ross-really?
Yeah, yeah, it'll be great! You can, you can lay on the beach and I can cry over my failed marriage. See-see how I make jokes?
Uh-huh.
No really, I mean, I mean, God, I could use a friend.
Oh wow, uh okay, uh maybe. Umm, yes, I can do that!
Okay!
Okay!
Cool!
All right!
Come on! Here.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Come on! (They go to the jetway, Ross hands the tickets to the gate agent.) Here.

utterances.transcript: Oh, okay, we're going. Yeah.
Ah! Ah! I forgot my jacket!
Oh, wait-wait-wait...
You tell them to wait!
Okay. Wait! Wait!

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Ross retrieves his jacket and sees that not only has Emily arrived, but she as seen Rachel take her place on the plane.)

utterances.transcript: Emily.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (She stares at him and Ross realises what she's thinking.)

utterances.transcript: Oh no-no-no! Oh-no! No! No! Emily!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh no-no-no! Oh-no! (Emily starts to run out and Ross chases her.) No! No! Emily!

utterances.transcript: Hey!
Hey!
Hi!

utterances.transcript_with_note: (They all hug.)

utterances.transcript: You ate meat! You had sex!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (To Joey) You ate meat! (Joey is shocked) (To Chandler and Monica) You had sex! (They're shocked.)

utterances.transcript: No we didn't!
I know you didn't, I was talking about Monica.
Phoebe, I did not have sex.

All right, I'm gonna go say hi the chick and the duck.

utterances.transcript: Well, we certainly are alone.
Yes! Good thing we have that, 'Not in New York' rule.

Right. Umm, listen since we're-we-re on that subject, umm, I just wanted to tell you that uh, well, I-I was going through a really hard time in London, what with my brother getting married and that guy thinking I was Ross's mother...
Right.
Well, an-anyway, I just-that night meant a lot to me, I guess I'm just trying to say thanks.
Oh. Y'know, that night meant a lot to me too, and it wasn't because I was in a bad place or anything, it just meant a lot to me 'cause, you're really hot! Is that okay?
That's okay.

utterances.transcript: And I'm cute too.
And you're cute too.
Thank you! All right, I gotta go unpack.

Bye.
